New Records: Rohit Sharma reached 200 sixes in T20Is, the most by any player.
Rohit Sharma hit 8 sixes in this game, the most by an Indian in a T20 World Cup innings.
Rohit Sharma scored 50 off 19 balls, his fastest in all T20s.
India's 100 runs in 8.4 overs is their fastest in T20 World Cups.
Rohit Sharma's 50 when India were 52 is the lowest team total when a batter has made a half-century in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 92 off 41 balls, hitting 76 of his runs in boundaries.
Jasprit Bumrah took a crucial wicket of Travis Head with a slower ball.
Kuldeep Yadav bowled Glenn Maxwell with a googly, a pivotal moment in the game.
Axar Patel took a spectacular catch to dismiss Mitchell Marsh.
Mitchell Starc took the wickets of Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav.
Josh Hazlewood bowled a masterful spell, giving away only 14 runs and taking the wicket of Virat Kohli.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Marsh mentioned the pitch looked like a belter and emphasized their experience in high-pressure World Cup matches.
Rohit Sharma noted the pitch looked good and emphasized the importance of adapting to challenges.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma's performance was highlighted as the reason for India's victory and their progression to the semi-finals.
Australia's chances of making the final four now depend on the outcome of the Bangladesh vs Afghanistan match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on the same pitch used for the England vs South Africa game, where 163 was defended.
The weather was cooler with significant cross-winds, which could have influenced the game.
